[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Software Development System (SDS) manages tasks, code collaboration, testing, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SDS includes task management, collaboration, code repository management, test generation, and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SDS integrates with GitHub, Jira, and Slack for task management and updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SDS provides web and mobile UIs for developers, testers, and project managers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SDS supports desktops, laptops, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SDS uses REST APIs for integration with repositories and project management tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SDS provides notifications via email, Slack, and in-app messaging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SDS optimizes storage for task data, reports, and code repositories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SDS supports task creation, code review, testing, and project tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SDS customizes notifications and dashboards for user roles.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SDS integrates with Jenkins and Slack for project updates and CI/CD pipelines.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SDS enables task management, code review, test case generation, project reporting, and service integration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SDS serves developers, testers, project managers, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SDS requires internet access for task updates, code commits, and collaboration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SDS depends on GitHub for version control and Jira for task management.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Project: Set of tasks and milestones.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow users to create tasks, set deadlines, assign responsibilities via web interface, and integrate with GitHub, Jira, and Slack for task management.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to create, assign, and track tasks (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support version control with pull requests and code reviews (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate automated test cases for input data, boundary conditions, and provide project status reports and progress tracking (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for task management and project tracking.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support seamless navigation through tasks and project reports.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall provide real-time updates on task assignments, code changes, and project milestones with a maximum latency of at least one second.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user data, project tasks, code version history, and reports in a secure database.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure secure user authentication, data storage, and protection of intellectual property.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data protection regulations like GDPR.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure encrypted communication, secure authentication, and reliable data storage.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate task management, version control, test generation, and reporting.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API docs, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Software practices, task management standards, and UX guidelines.
